messages.body: $TSLA MIT study is starting to trend:  most accurate climate change models predict the most alarming consequences.  https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/energy-environment/wp/2017/12/06/the-most-accurate-climate-change-models-predict-the-most-alarming-consequences-study-claims/?utm_term=.c5cb172b2b94

links.title: The most accurate climate change models predict the most alarming consequences, study finds
links.description: The climate change simulations that best capture current planetary conditions are also the ones that predict the most dire levels of human-driven warming, according to a statistical study released in the journal Nature Wednesday.

links.title: Ex-VW exec gets seven years in 'dieselgate' scandal
links.description: A US court on Wednesday sentenced former Volkswagen executive Oliver Schmidt to seven years in prison for his role in the German automaker's "dieselgate" emissions cheating scandal.

links.title: So much for those rosier global-warming projections, says reality
links.description: Asian Development Bank | Flickr Global warming's worst-case projections look increasingly likely, according to a new study that tested the predictive power of climate models against observations of how the atmosphere is actually behaving.
